Patbaushi Satra was established by great guru of vaisnavism Mahapurush Srimanta Sankardeva. He spent about 18 years of his life at Patbaushi Satra where he had composed Borgeet and other valuable writings in the form of dramas. Patbaushi satra is situated about three to four kilometers from Barpeta town, popularly called Satranagari. The literature work written on 'Sashipat' are preserved in the dates along with the other valuables. There are several items like gifts received from Chilarai, Mukha etc. are also preserved in this site.
This is the last satra established by Mahapurush Srimanta Sankardev. The area is big and also a museum is there which has some remaining items used by Sankardev's second wife Kalindi.
A revered place for Vaisnavites of Assam. Srimanta Sankardev the doyen of Vaishnavism lived here and preached his learning to his disciples.
Great work of Mahapurush SriManta Shankardev are preserved. It shows our rich cultural heritage.

Sundaridiya Satra located near Barpeta town in Barpeta district is one of the most prominent Satras (Vaishnavite Monsataries ) in Assam. It was established by Sri Sri Madhabdev, the principal disciple of Srimanta Shankardev, the 15th Century Vaishnavite Saint and social reformer. This is the place where Sri Sri Madhbadev stayed for a significant period of time and composed Bhakti Ratnakar and Namghosa, two of his most prominent works. #AwesomeAssam#SundaridiyaSatra

Barpeta Satra, popularly known as Barpeta Kirtan Ghar, was established by Vaishnavite saint Mahapurush Madhabdeva in 1583 AD which was previously known as  Barpeta Than. After Madhabdeva  Still Mathuradasa Atta became first Satradhikar after taking care of the Satra. The structure of the Satra was built as a Kutcha House and in 1878 it was rebuild on concrete structure. One can reach this Vaishnavite Cultural Site by train (nearest railway station Barpeta Road) and well connected by road from Guwahati.

The Barpeta Kirtanghar gate stands as a majestic testament to the rich cultural heritage and spiritual significance of the revered temple complex. Crafted with meticulous detail and adorned with intricate carvings, the gate serves as the gateway to a realm of devotion and transcendence.As you approach the Barpeta Kirtanghar gate, you are immediately struck by its grandeur. Rising tall and proud, the gate commands attention with its imposing presence. Carved from sturdy stone, it bears the marks of time, each weathered groove and crevice telling the story of centuries past.The surface of the gate is adorned with ornate motifs and symbolic imagery, reflecting the deep-rooted traditions and beliefs of the region. Intricate patterns of lotus flowers, sacred animals, and celestial beings adorn its surface, each element infused with spiritual significance and meaning.At the center of the gate, a magnificent archway beckons you forward, its graceful curves inviting you to step into the sacred space beyond. Flanked by towering pillars adorned with sculpted figures of gods and goddesses, the archway serves as a portal to another world – a world of devotion, prayer, and divine grace.As you pass beneath the archway, you feel a sense of reverence wash over you. It is as if the very air is charged with spiritual energy, enveloping you in a cocoon of tranquility and peace. The sounds of distant chants and the gentle rustle of leaves mingle together, creating a symphony of serenity that fills your heart with awe.On either side of the gate, lush gardens stretch out before you, their vibrant colors and fragrant blooms adding to the sense of beauty and wonder. Tall trees stand sentinel, their branches reaching towards the sky in silent prayer, while colorful birds flit and flutter amongst the foliage, their melodious songs adding to the enchantment of the scene.But amidst the natural splendor, it is the gate itself that captures your attention – a testament to the craftsmanship and devotion of those who built it. Each intricately carved detail speaks to a reverence for the divine and a commitment to upholding the sacred traditions of the temple.As you pause to take in the breathtaking sight before you, you are filled with a sense of gratitude and humility. Gratitude for the opportunity to stand in the presence of such beauty and majesty, and humility in the face of the timeless wisdom and grace that permeates this sacred space.And as you step forward, crossing the threshold of the Barpeta Kirtanghar gate, you do so with a heart full of reverence and awe, ready to embark on a journey of spiritual discovery and inner transformation.
